===== What falls within the scope of psychotherapy=====
- The majority of psychiatric disorders & certain non-psychiatric disorders (e.g. chronic pain, functional neurological disorders, etc.)

- Alone or in conjunction with pharmacotherapy and social therapy

Favourable factors :

- Patient commitment/request

- Quality therapeutic alliance

- Therapist empathy

- Specific, validated psychotherapeutic tools

- Setting: therapeutic objective, duration

question.title: What is psychotherapy?
question.description: The main principles that distinguish psychotherapy from mere conversation or from the many approaches that have not been validated.

option_a.title: Psychotherapy is a type of therapy that focuses on the patient's mental health.
option_a.description: The majority of psychiatric disorders & certain non-psychiatric disorders (e.g. chronic pain, functional neurological disorders, etc.).

option_b.title: Psychotherapy is a type of therapy that focuses on the patient's physical health.
option_b.description: Alone or in conjunction with pharmacotherapy and social therapy.

option_c.title: Psychotherapy is a type of therapy that focuses on the patient's emotional well-being.
option_c.description: Favourable factors : Patient commitment/request, Quality therapeutic alliance, Therapist empathy, Specific, validated psychotherapeutic tools, Setting: therapeutic objective, duration.

option_d.title: Psychotherapy is a type of therapy that focuses on the patient's spiritual well-being.
option_d.description: Caregiver-patient relationship: Based on respect & empathy, Without specific training in psychotherapy.

correct_option.title: Psychotherapy is a type of therapy that focuses on the patient's mental health.
correct_option.description: The main principles that distinguish psychotherapy from mere conversation or from the many approaches that have not been validated.
